【SPECIALITY】Multi-layer compositse steel effectively solves the cooking conduction problem of pure steel and makes quick & even heat transfer for cooking like deep frying, broiling, sautéing,and braising.

【HIGH-QUALITY MATERIALS】Made with High-quality stainless steel, our stir fry pan is built to last. The healthy non-coated surface is completely non toxic for the better balance of utility and performance than teflon or ceramic pans.

【Professionally Design】With an ergonomic handle and versatile compatibility with all stovetop types and oven safe, this frying pan is a must-have for any kitchen.This is the best induction cookware and kitchen essentials for new apartment.The durable construction and comfortable design make it easy to cook and handle food.

【UNIVERSAL】Our stainless steel pans and woks work safe on all types of stovetops, including gas, electric, glass, halogen, comes with small and large size making it a versatile addition to your handy cookware collection.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Why Choose ACESELF stainless steel Skillet? Our Tri-Ply stainless steel surface doesn't react with food or alter flavors. Furthermore, it does not contain PFOA, a substance harmful to health. For you and your family, it's a healthier choice.
Healthier This pan has a high-performance, enduring, multi-layer surface that effortlessly process food.
3-layer composite steel Stainless steel induction base Perfect for bacon,steak and omlette

Prepare Meals For The People You Love The greatest joys often come from life's most uncomplicated moments. Craft a delightful and healthy dish with a touch of innovation and a dash of affection, while relishing the company of your family and friends.
Universal Our pan works on all types of stovetops, including gas, electric, glass, halogen. Suitable as camping skillet and pans for cooking.

USE & CARE Stay away from metal utensil in cooking as well as steel wools in cleaning. 1.When preheating the pan, it's best not to preheat for too long, as the pan can become too hot and cause the eggs to stick. 2.Use an adequate amount of oil on the flat pan. 3.When frying eggs, it's advisable to use medium to low heat. Stainless steel has fast heat conductivity, and using medium to low heat will produce similar heat levels to what you'd get with aluminum cookware on high heat. 4.Recommend hand washing for longer term use. Suitable for dishwasher.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 12 inch Tri-Ply Stainless Steel Frying Pan. Well made; distributes heat evenly; handle is removable.
reviews.reviewText: The Aceself brand's "12-inch Tri-Ply Stainless Steel Frying Pan" offers a durable and versatile cooking solution for any kitchen.The pan is made with a high-quality stainless steel that conducts heat well and is easy to maintain.Stainless steel is generally an inert material that does not affect food taste or flavor. And while it has no non-stick coating, most foods will not stick to a stainless steel pan that is well heated before use and if the food is not moved before a crust develops on your cooked items.The pan has a multi-layer composite steel ensures quick and even heat transfer, making it suitable for various cooking techniques like deep frying, sautéing, and braising.Compatible with all stovetop types, including induction, and oven safe, this frying pan is very versatile and easy to use.Can be easily hand or machine washed, but avoid using harsh chemicals or aggressive scrubbing pads to prolong the life of your pan.Pros:Tri-Ply Stainless Steel Construction: Provides durability and even heat distribution for efficient cooking.Multi-Layer Composite Steel: Solves the conduction problem of pure steel, ensuring quick and even heat transfer.High-Quality Materials: Made with high-quality stainless steel, the pan is built to last and is free from toxic coatings.Ergonomic Design: Features an ergonomic handle for comfortable handling and versatile compatibility with all stovetop types.Universal Compatibility: Works safely on gas, electric, glass, halogen, and induction stovetops, offering versatility in cooking.Cons:Assembly Required: The handle needs to be attached to the pan upon receipt, requiring the use of included nuts and a wrench for assembly.Limited Size Options: Currently available only in a 12-inch size, limiting options for those seeking different pan sizes for their cooking needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not quite 12", but well made
reviews.reviewText: I've never bought a full-sized frying pan that requires assembly before. That being said, it was easy to attach the handle, and came with a wrench to do so. This 12 inch pan easily fits inside my 12 inch All-Clad pan, so I'm doubtful that it is actually 12 inches (more like 11 or 11 1/2). It does seem well-made, and closely resembles my KitchenAid frying pans. The descriptive booklet that came with it is garbage, with some things not making sense at all (maybe a poor translation). It also mentioned something about the magnet test not working to determine if it was stainless, so I did worry for a moment. I do know that not all stainless is magnetic, and only that which is will work for induction. I tested it with a magnet, and it did stick, meaning it will work on my induction stove. It does not have a visible non-stick coating, other than just the inherent properties of stainless, but I did not expect (or want) one. I like that the screws are internal, so there is not a rivet on the frying surface. I am also slightly confused about why many of the reviews are actually for a different product, which I recognize as a four-egg pan I ordered and reviewed a while back (and it no longer seems to be available). This pan, while the same brand, is very different from that one!

reviews.reviewerName: The Tipsy Candle The Tipsy Candle
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Hands down this is the best cookware I could have ever ordered. It is stainless steel from the handle to the skillet. It is very durable. I’m not sure if it is nonstick as I have not dared to cook with it yet. What I love about the skillet is that obviously it’s composite steel it has multiple layers that can solve any heat problems or uncooked areas of your food. It also is rivet free meaning on the inside of the skillet itself, there are no bothersome rivets that might hinder cooking your food properly. It’s very easy to clean just wash and dry.Another feature that I really enjoy is that you can use either iron or steel, spatula or tongs. Whatever you’re cooking with or frying or stirring it won’t scratch. I have a glass top stove that works perfectly for this skillet and I just use a small thin layer of oil before I fry or cook something unless I’m deep frying it. Wonderful quality product. I am completely satisfied and I highly recommend. Also, just a sidenote from any of you, that may be asking, this steel skillet automatically creates a nonstick effect when I use oil to cook with and the way to prevent ruining your beautiful skillet is make sure that your oil is heated up enough prior to cooking something and not sticking and burning the pan. I wish this had a lid that came with it, but because I love the product so much, I will be looking into a whole set of this fabulous cookware for any chef that is Eyring to be a top chef in their home

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent 12" Stainless Steel Skillet
reviews.reviewText: This skillet arrived nicely and securely packaged to avoid damage from shipping. The handle was not assembled to the skillet, to allow use of a smaller package. Directions for assembly were included, but not needed, as it required only two nuts to be tightened over protruding threaded studs on the pan itself.A small wrench was provided to assemble the handle to the skillet, however it shouldn't be used as it fits too loosely and it's likely to either deform itself during tightening or damage the nuts. Instead use a 12 mm wrench, socket, or nut driver. In addition an extra nut was thoughtfully included, just in case!The pan itself performed nicely with even heating, no discoloration, and it was easy to clean. I used it on an induction plate and an electric stove with no problems. The handle is smooth, comfortable and remained cool during heating. I did not try the pan in an oven.It remains to be seen how this pan will hold up over time, but for now I really like it and do recommend it.
